channel.title: Sessions on Josh Wood
channel.description: Recent content in Sessions on Josh Wood

item.title: Courtyard
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Paros. October 2006.

I stood on the rail and looked over the stone wall of the courtyard
Through the crosshairs of the crucifix atop the blue dome of the church
I saw people moving in the house-lights on the hillside
They seemed like signals

item.title: Roy Orbison
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
pretty woman, give your smile to me
that is an imperative
I want to try it on
and I promise
not to wipe it off
with my greaserag this time
that last incident having been merely
a confusion of identity of me
for my brother who is not me
but is often mistaken for me

he’s the one who can play guitar

item.title: An advantage of angles
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Kansas City/Paros. November 2005.

Not every night is different
most begin with much the same choreography
a geometry of sky folding closed and Sound
thrown out of a day’s dance with the wind
when Silence cuts in.

Stars pick out jasmine’s shadow negative against
their black matting, their paper backing, where

item.title: Inked (Don’t You Call Me (two (too) Haikus))
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Kansas City. November 2005.

triple ribbon is
efficient because it
abandoned hue
